characters: AND BURIED FOR ALL TIME HIS...
INTO THE SKY IS RA, SUN GOD. SEALED
MAP ON THE BACK WALL OF THE CONTROL ROOM 65
RETURNING FROM A KILL. THEY MARCH TOWARDS A SMALL CAMPSIT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young BOY chisels his artwork into the stone ROCKFACE a the edge of this valley. An old MEDICINE MAN, his face painted with bizarre white stripes, CHANTS nearby. The boy abruptly stops his work at the SOUND of distant C Quickly he climbs the stone. Standing at the top he SEES. HUNTERS.

dialogues.speaker: RETURNING FROM A KILL. THEY MARCH TOWARDS A SMALL CAMPSIT
dialogues.text: The tribes people rushing to greet them. Super up: North Africa 8000 B.C.

dialogues.speaker: A BLAZING FIRE
dialogues.text: Silhouetted tribesmen dancing in bizarre animal MASKS. Fe STOMPING. The young Boy stares at the fire, SPARKS rising into the air. We PAN UP following the sparks into the sky A full moon. A SHADOW is suddenly cast across the moon, blotting it ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young Boy sleeps. Above him hangs an odd carving that slowly begins to RATTLE. The tent's fabric begins to FLAP The Boy's eyes pop open. He HEARS the sounds of a quickly brewing storm. Footsteps. People hurrying, calling out to each other. Suddenly the tent's entrance flap SAILS OPEN. BRIGHT LIGHT pours in through the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boy exits his tent, staring at the light, intrigued. storm building all around. Unnatural and eerie. Panicked, the tribesmen run in fear, racing away from the light. The Medicine man, on his knees CHANTING.  10 11 The only one without fear, the Boy pushes through them, towards the light. Tents begin to RIP from their posts in the strong GALE WINDS. As the frightened clan retreats, the young Boy moves clos and closer to the light, squinting through the blurring s A loud ROARING SOUND, building in ferocity. Slowly we PUSH into an extreme CLOSE UP of the young Boy' eyes which widen. If we could only see what he sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT PYRAMID
dialogues.text: A glowing orange setting SUN just above the pyramid's pea A car drives past. Super up: GIZA, EGYPT - 1928

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROFESSOR LANGFORD and his nine year old daughter CATHERI who reads from a thick text book, are RATTLING in the bac seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car SCREECHES to a halt. The passenger door opens and Professor Langford JUMPS out. Catherine follows. As they make their way down the ravine we slowly reveal t breadth of this work site. Hundreds of Arab men digging away in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN TAYLOR 11
dialogues.text: Is crouched on the ground dusting off three large TABLETS covered in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics. Professor Lang walks up behind him, staring in awe.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Cover stones. We found them this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: LANGFORD
dialogues.text: Amazing. But why did you move them? Catherine walks over to a small table, examining other artifacts. She picks up a small GOLDEN SUN DISK; a circul SYMBOL of the sun emblazoned on a gold disk.  12 13 14 15 16

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There was something hidden underneath.

dialogues.speaker: LANGFORD
dialogues.text: Hidden? Taylor leads Langford over to a large digging pit several yards away. Slowly we TRACK across the sand, over the lip of the digging pit revealing a handful of workers struggl to secure ropes onto something hidden beyond our view. Suddenly the ropes grow taut as they begin to lift.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE METALLIC RING 12
dialogues.text: over twenty feet in diameter. The RING is slowly lifted o of the pit revealing its shape and structure. It doesn't seem to belong to ancient Egypt. And perhaps not even this world.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR AND LANGFORD 13
dialogues.text: As they stare in wonder at this newly found treasure. You Catherine squeezes in between the two.

dialogues.speaker: LANGFORD
dialogues.text: (whispering) What is that thing, Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I wish I knew.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING 14
dialogues.text: as it's lifted upright, suspended above them. An amazing sight.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE 15
dialogues.text: Staring, fascinated. Suddenly the lenses of her glasses CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold rainy winter day. Traffic gridlock. Horns honking, cabbies yelling. A grey LIMOUSINE is stuck in traffic. Super up: NEW YORK, PRESENT DAY Through the rain-soaked passenger window we see an ELDERLY WOMAN impatiently chec her watch. Unheard by us, she speaks to her DRIVER who ex and opens the passenger door for her. Taking an umbrella from her driver, the Elderly Woman ste out and makes her way down the center of the street.  17 18 19 4. We FOLLOW her through the dense traffic and up into a bui marked: ARCHAEOLOGICAL SOCIETY OF AMERICA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing the microphone, the M.C. adjusts the feedback as leans close to address a gathering of distinguished Archaeologists. M.C. Our next guest speaker today will be an extraordinary young man...

dialogues.speaker: BOOKS AND PAPERS 18
dialogues.text: Clumsily this stack of books and papers are organized ato man's lap. Gathered together, they're lifted as the man attempts to make his way out of his seat, down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: (sotto) Excuse me... Pardon me... M.C. ...He graduated with his masters at the age of 20 and speaks eleven different languages. He has written several seminal articles on the comparative linguistics of the Afro- Asiatic language groups and the development of the Egyptian language from the Archaic Period to the Old Kingdom. Please let me introduce to you, Daniel Jackson. CRASH. The books TUMBLE to the floor. As he leans down to pick them up we SEE for the first time, DANIEL JACKSON, nervously retrieving his belongings.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSORS 19
dialogues.text: An older PROFESSOR leans over to his companion.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Ah, another Wunderkind.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANION
dialogues.text: I've got socks older than this kid. Daniel makes his way to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: You, Sir. What kind of car do you drive? Daniel points to the Professor who made the remark.  20 21

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: My car? Um..a Ford.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: A model T?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: (peeved) I'm not that old. It's an Escort.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: An Escort. Power steering, fuel injection. Modern "developments." Ford starts with a model T then "develops" into an Escort. The audience doesn't get where Daniel's going with this.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why didn't Egyptian culture develop? Their sciences, art, mathematics, everything was complete from the very beginning. Why? Maybe, Egyptian civilization was not a "development" but a legacy! There is an audible REACTION from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elderly Woman walks past the beautifully displayed Egyptian artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The Mastaba tombs around the pyramid are covered with hieroglyphics; names, titles of owners, lists of offerings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elderly Woman enters from the back of the room, her e fixed on Daniel. Absently she fingers the GOLDEN SUN DISK hanging from around her neck. This is CATHERINE LANGFORD, no longer the child we met in Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: But the pyramid, the greatest structure ever erected, has no writings whatsoever. Why? An imposing older man, PROFESSOR THOMAS interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Mr. Jackson, you've conveniently left out the fact that Colonel Vyse discovered quarrymen's inscriptions (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Khufu's name written within the Pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: His discovery was a fraud. The room ERUPTS in angry dissent.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You can prove that, I hope? With surprising speed, Daniel draws a series of hieroglyp on the black board behind the podium.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: This was the cartouche Vyse claimed to have found in the relieving chambers above the King's Chamber of the pyramid. He circles the first symbol (a clear circle with a dot in the middle).

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But this symbol, representing the first consonant in the name Khufu is incorrect. The correct symbol is... He draws a circle with the center darkened.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the same exact misspelling of Khufu's name that appeared in Wilkinson's Materia Hieroglphyica, the book that Colonel Vyse used to forge his big discovery. However, in the very next edition of the same book, they revised their translations to correct this error. (beat) The editor of this book admit his mistake but we, the academic community, refuse to. AS several people begin to get out of their seats and wal out, another PROFESSOR (#2) jumps to his feet, incensed.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Don't you think it's rather arrogant to suggest the last hundred years of academic research is a collection of lies?!  He stands join him,

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I'm simply saying that the great pyramids of Giza were not built by the Pharaohs of the fourth Dynasty.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. I won't sit and listen to this nonsense. and exits the auditorium. As others in the audience Catherine Langford steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mr. Jackson, who do you think built the pyramids? There is an awkward silence as Daniel searches for an ans

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I don't know. A heavy set BEARDED MAN smiles and calls out.

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED MAN
dialogues.text: Men from Atlantis? The audience ERUPTS IN LAUGHTER, cueing more people to st

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or Martians perhaps?!

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I didn't say that...

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED MAN
dialogues.text: No, but you were about to. More laughter. Daniel SEES more people filing out. Quickl he tries to organize his notes but is clearly flustered.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: If we could just get back to the subject. Perhaps their civilization lies in the buried Wadis of Western Sahara. In the Predynastic period these areas would have been rich with food and animals. New geological evidence pre-dates that Sphinx to a much earlier period, confirming my hypothesis.. But as Daniel looks up from his material he SEES the last several people left in the room, filing out the back door.  22 23 24 25

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AT PODIUM 22
dialogues.text: Alone in the room, Daniel stands at the podium. Sadly he slowly closes his text.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in a crowd, Daniel struggles with his books in the rain as he exits the busy subway exit. Absently he steps out into the street. HONK. A cab slams on the brakes, nea hitting him.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: Wake up you idiot! Startled, Daniel hurries out of harms way as he passes a small FRUIT STAND. The ARMENIAN owner greets Daniel in hi native language, tossing him an apple. Daniel responds with fluid ARMENIAN as he catches the app on his way over to an old brownstone building. He steps around a grey LIMOUSINE double parked in front o his building as he makes his way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dripping wet, Daniel steps into the hallway. He stops as HEARS opera music playing through an open door at the end the hallway. Slowly he makes his way to the open door only to find, Catherine Langford, sitting inside, relaxed and smoking a cigarette. She holds in her hand a bust of a beautiful Egyptian woman.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (re: bust) 14th century, B.C. Nice reproduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken off guard, Daniel walks into his apartment. His roo is a mess, multiple stacks of BOOKS line every wall, hieroglyphic tracings and reproductions of Egyptian art.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: How did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your landlord told me you're three months behind in your rent, shame on you. Daniel puts down his drenched text books and removes his dripping overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: You were at the lecture. Catherine returns the bust to a table next to a PHOTO of young couple.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Your parents?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Foster.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Your real parents died in a plane crash in...'73? She holds her cigarette out, requesting an ash tray.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Let's cut to the chase, shall we? Why are you here? Daniel puts a dead potted plant in front of Catherine. Reluctantly she puts her cigarette out in its dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: To offer you a job.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: A job? What job?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Translation. I want to put you to work on some ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Since when is the military interested in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (surprised) Who said anything about the military? Daniel walks close to her, defiantly.  26 10.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: In front of my building is a grey Lincoln town car with government plates. Its chauffeur is wearing a crewcut 'stead of a black cap. And the only way you could have gotten past my Nazi of a landlord was to flash some pretty fancy credentials. (beat) So why is the military interested in ancient Egyptian hieroglyphics? Catherine is clearly impressed. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I wish I could tell you more but I am not allowed.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What makes you think I'd take a job I don't know anything about?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You mean beyond the fact that you have no family, no friends, and no hope of paying that stack of bills sitting on your desk? Daniel sneaks a sidelong glance at his mountain of mail.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Well, uh, yes. Catherine stands, walks closer to Daniel. She pulls out a snapshot from her bag and holds it in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: To prove that your theories are right.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO 26
dialogues.text: A snapshot of the tablets found at Giza in 1928. Mesmerized Daniel grabs at the photo, but Catherine quick pulls it away. She knows she's hooked him. She hands hima stuffed envelope, instead.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Your travel plans. She turns and heads for the door. Daniel calls out to her

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I'm not big on flying.  27 28 11.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get over it. Daniel watches her walk away, then stares at the envelope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark sedan with a GOVERNMENT SEAL comes to a stop in fr of a lower middle-class suburban house. Two OFFICERS in military garb step out of the car and march to the front door of the house. Super up: Yuma, Arizona As they walk, we SEE a black military FOLDER one of them carries. The first Officer knocks on the door. The door opens to reveal, SARAH, mid-thirties, tense. The pain she carries tarnishes her once beautiful face.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Mrs O'Neil? Seeing the Officer's military attire, she nods, moving aw from the door.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on in. Sarah disappears into the house. The two Officers exchang a glance and follow her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immaculately kept, ordered. Sarah moves into the kitchen the two officers awkwardly make their way into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Uh, Mrs O'Neil, is your husband at home? She answers from the kitchen where she continues her chor

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Do you think we might be able to speak with him?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You can try.  29 30 31 32 12. Still she continues to clean in the kitchen. After a long beat...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: And where would we find him?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Last door, end of the hall. The Officer nods his appreciation as he and his partner h down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN HALL 29
dialogues.text: As they make their way down the hall, they reach an open doorway at the hall's end. Peering in they SEE, a teenage boy's room. Perfectly kept. Sports trophies, footballs, etc. As we TRACK across the room's belongings we FIND a man si in a chair facing the window, his back towards us.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Colonel O'Neil? We're from General West's office. But the man in the chair doesn't turn around.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL JACK O'NEIL 30
dialogues.text: For the first time we see COLONEL JACK O'NEIL, long hair, six day growth, intense and troubled eyes. There is nothi military looking about this guy. He stares vacantly out t window.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER 31
dialogues.text: Sarah looks out the kitchen window and SEES the two Offic returning to their car outside. Sarah turns and slowly wa to the back of the house. As she approaches an open bedroom door, she stops, peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: P.0O.V.
dialogues.text: The black FOLDER laying on the bed. A pressed military UNIFORM is laid down next to the folder.  33 34 35 36 37 13. Pained, Sarah shuts her eyes and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 33
dialogues.text: Quickly, we SAIL over the treetops through this dense for area. At the edge of the treeline we FIND a beat up and bruised Chevy, sputtering up the windy mountain road. Super up: Creek Mountain, Colorado

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy pulls up to a gate where two MARINES stand guar One walks up to Daniel's window. Daniel opens the envelop Catherine gave him and hands some papers to the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Daniel Jackson. I think I'm supposed to show this to.. SNEEZE. Daniel grabs for a Kleenex.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Cold?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: No. Allergies. Always happens when I travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of MARINES are in the midsts of vigorous training Led by LIEUTENANT KAWALSKY, early thirties, big, friendly and eager. With a loud BACKFIRE, we SEE the Chevy making its way pas Lt. Kawalsky signals for another soldier to take over, th heads after Daniel. As he walks away, the others stop and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tunneled into the side of a mountain, a large hollowed entrance. Daniel has parked next to it and is struggling pull an enormous bag out of his trunk.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Daniel Jackson? Startled, Daniel turns to see Kawalsky rushing up. Kawals grabs and shakes Daniel's hand.  38 39 40 41 42 14.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dr. Langford was worried you changed your mind.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: It took me three days to drive. Again Daniel tries to lift his bag out but he can't.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Help you with that? He reaches in for Daniel's bag.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Careful, books, they're very... Effortlessly Kawalsky lifts the bag out with one hand, SLAMMING the trunk down shut with the other.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .. heavy. He follows Kawalsky into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANIEL follows Kawalsky into the dark tunnel. Two large CONCRETE DOORS open to reveal a METAL SHACK, a GUARD stan alongside it. The guard hits a button on the desk and sha OPENS exposing a STEEL CAGE inside. They walk over and en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly with a loud hydraulic ROAR, the cage quickly DES DOWNWARD. We WATCH as the cage DROPS down, deeper and dee

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S P.0.V.
dialogues.text: Daniel counts the LARGE NUMBERS painted on the shaft wall as they descend. They pass 18, 19, 20... so on. Daniel tries to take it all in. Suddenly the cage STOPS. The number reads 28. The two and the eight are separated the DOORS OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S P.0O.V.
dialogues.text: Several sterile hallways lead towards us, active with foo traffic.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS 42
dialogues.text: Daniel follows Kawalsky down the main hallway. Walking out of an open office door is MEYERS, a balding m aged scientist who extends his hand to Daniel as they wal  43 44 15.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: Mr. Jackson, Dr. Gary Meyers.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Hi. Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A nuclear missile silo. Daniel turns to find BARBARA SHORE, late-thirties, walkin up alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's been completely converted. Barbara Shore. The token Astrophysicist on the team. Kawalsky stops at the end of the hall, turning back to Da

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: This is where you'll be working. Kawalsky opens the door. They all enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel's eyes widen. A large workroom. The walls are cove with charcoal rubbings and photo enlargements of hieroglyphics. On two large tables are various artifacts. Meyers moves over to the back wall and pulls down a sheet that was covering...

dialogues.speaker: THE GIZA TABLETS, (FROM THE OPENING)
dialogues.text: The Giza tablets have been fastened to the wall. Daniel i truly amazed, hypnotized. Standing near the tablets, Catherine looks up from some papers and walks over to Dan

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Glad you decided to join us.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Where did you find them?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Giza Plateau. 1928. (pointing out parts of tablets) There are two lines of hieroglyphs. The outer edge which has some familiar figures, as you can see. She points to a chalk board next to the hieroglyphics tha has a loose translation; YEAR 10 OF KING ?, SKY, RA, THE DISK, COFFIN, DOOR TO HEAVEN.  16.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then there is the inner track, here. These symbols, as you can see, are unlike any ever found. (after a beat) Like Champillion with the Rosetta Stone, we tried to compare the two readings against each other for any similarities. Daniel, still in awe, walks over to the translation, exam it.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: It's all wrong. what did you use, Budge? Why do they keep reprinting his books?

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: We tried decoding and translation computer programs, used every known technique, for years with no result... Daniel erases the word TIME on the blackboard and replace it with the word YEARS. Peeved, Meyers steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Catherine stops him, watching Daniel, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: That's a curious word to use "qebeh." Then an adverbial sedjem-en-ef with a cleft subject "sealed and buried"... (turning to Meyers) NOT coffin. Shore walks up next to Kawalsky, together they watch Dani work quickly re-working the translation.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: (to Daniel) What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: "Forever to eternity for all time". You really should have gotten that one. Shore looks over at Meyers with an "I told you so" attitu As Daniel steps back from the board we SEE he has nearly completed the translation of the top part of the Tablets.  45 17.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This should read, A MILLION YEARS

dialogues.speaker: AND BURIED FOR ALL TIME HIS...
dialogues.text: Then Daniel circles the last word.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not DOOR to HEAVEN. The proper translation is... STARGATE. There is a stunned beat. They can't believe how fast Dani can work. Slowly Daniel turns back to them.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, now will somebody please tell me why the military has assembled a team of archaeological scientists in a nuclear missile silo on top of mount nowhere to study five thousand year old Egyptian tablets?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: My report says, ten thousand. The group turns to SEE...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL O'NEIL 45
dialogues.text: Dressed in full military attire, his hair cropped tight, Colonel, in sharp contrast to the man we met before, is n the very image of the spit-and-polish soldier.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Ten thousand? Everyone turns, surprised at this intrusion. Clearly the others in the room do not recognise O'Neil. Kawalsky snap to attention.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Sir.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: At ease. O'Neil opens the black folder, removes some papers and ha them over to Kawalsky.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, do I know...

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Jack O'Neil from General West's office. I'll be taking over from now on.  18. Shocked, Catherine turns to Kawalsky who looks up at the papers and nods; it's true. Daniel could care less about the changing of the guard and steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Ten thousand? That's impossible. Egyptian civilization didn't even exist until...

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: We know, but the sonic and Radiocarbon tests are conclusive. Look at these artifacts from associated and overlying strata. Clearly Epipaleolithic or Neolithic, probably related to the Natufian in Palestine. Entirely consistent with the Ninth to Tenth Millennium B.C. date.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: These are cover stones. Was there a tomb underneath?

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: No. But we found something much more interesting. O'Neil interrupts, stepping between them.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Excuse me, but this information has become classified.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: (confused) Catherine, what's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: From now on, no information will be passed on to non military personnel without my expressed permission.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: You can't be serious. This is ludicrous. What the hell am I doing here?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: You're a translator, so translate. Lieutenant, I want all information not directly pertaining to these tablets to be removed and brought to my office immediately.  46 19. O'Neil turns for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Your office, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: (turning back) And I'll need an office.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Yes Sir! Kawalsky rushes for the door and leads O'Neil out. O'Neil marches out. The group exchange confused glances.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I'll handle this. Catherine goes running after O'Neil. Meyers and Shore exi behind her leaving a confused Daniel alone with the Table

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (to himself) Ten thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawalsky leads O'Neil down the hallway. From the rear, Catherine rushes to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Colonel, just a minute. (O'Neil stops) I think you owe me some kind of explanation. I was told I'd have complete autonomy.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Plans change.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Things have gotten too loose around here. You've even brought in another civilian.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Jackson was approved.  47 20.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: To translate. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with Jackson, does it? What's this all about? why did they bring you in? At first he doesn't want to answer. Finally he decides to tell her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: I'm here in case you succeed. O'Neil turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the strains of seventeenth century opera music pouring out of a ghetto blaster, we PAN across the darkened lab. Daniel's belongings are spread throughout the room, inclu his Egyptian bust. Open books scattered all over the floo The room is a mess. AS we see the Tablets, we TRACK UP the scaffolding surrou it until we find Daniel, laying by the top of the Tablets Daniel, looking harried and tired, is deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you have a problem with the food here? You've barely eaten in days. Daniel leans over the edge of the scaffolding and SEES Kawalsky standing below, a tray of food in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want anything else?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: A point of reference. Some context. You want me to solve a puzzle but you won't give me the clues.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: You know I'm under strict orders.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: So disobey orders. You know what Shakespeare said, "Let them obey that know not how to rule." Kawalsky calmly puts the tray of food down on the desk  48 49 50 51 21.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Must be tough to always be the smartest person in the room. Kawalsky turns and exits. Frustrated, Daniel lays back do onto the scaffolding. Daniel rolls over and climbs down the scaffolding and wal over to a table. He grabs the coffee pot only to find it empty. Carrying the pot with him, Daniel exits the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he steps out of the lab, a NIGHT WATCHMAN looks u from his post. Daniel holds the empty pot up.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Out of water. The Watchman nods as Daniel moves down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning the corner, pot in hand, Daniel passes O'Neil's office; O'Neil's name freshly painted on the door. Checki to see that he's unobserved, Daniel walks up to the offic door. Daniel examines a KEYPAD at the side of the door. He reac into his pocket and pulls out a small pair of nail clippe He jimmies the top of the pad open with the clippers and jams them into the wiring, SPARKS jump. Suddenly the offi door glides OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like his home, O'Neil's office is immaculately kept. Dani creeps inside, scanning the room. He SEES a file cabinet and rushes over to it. But as he opens its drawers he finds they are all empty. Daniel opens the closet door and finds a large SAFE, very high security. He looks down at the tiny nail clippers st in his hand. No way. Casually Daniel goes through the desk drawers, but again, empty. Finally in the last drawer he finds a photo of O'Neil's wife and son. Suddenly the GLOW of a computer sc catches his eye. Daniel picks up the keyboard and starts typing.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: Below the words, UNITED STATES ARMED FORCES, Daniel types the word "query" a highlight list appears. Daniel moves t highlight over the word PERSONNEL. The word SEARCH appear  52 53 54 55 22. Daniel types in COLONEL JACK O'NEIL. The computer respond PLEASE WAIT... Impatiently Daniel waits. Suddenly the SHADOW of a guard SEEN through the door. Daniel FREEZES. The guard passes. Daniel looks back down to the computer and sees...

dialogues.speaker: DUTY, ONE MONTH.
dialogues.text: Daniel types something into the computer but the only res he gets is; CLASSIFIED. Frustrated, Daniel shuts the desktop and moves towards th exit. But just as he's about to walk out the door, he spo something on the wall, back up.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S P.0.V.
dialogues.text: of the known universe. Several of the star constellations marked out in white. Daniel reaches up and the Star Map gets violently RIPPED from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCANNER
dialogues.text: A bar of WHITE LIGHT scans across the table top, over the STAR MAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuffing his face with a SNICKERS BAR, DANIEL sits behind the bank of computers, working furiously.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: The screen FILLS with the image of one of the hieroglyphi We PAN UP from the computer to see it on the TABLETS just beyond the screen. Quickly Daniel punches something up on the computer. The computer screen SPLITS putting the image of the hieroglyp on one side and the map's ORION star constellation on the other. Making some adjustments on the computer, Daniel ROTATES t image from the Star Map until it forms the SAME SHAPE AS HIEROGLYPHIC. They are, in fact, the same symbol! Daniel turns to his Egyptian bust.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Bingo!

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY LIMOUSINES
dialogues.text: Sliding to a stop. Dust. Doors opening. Stepping out of the limos we SEE a DOZEN high ranking military OFFICIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group of OFFICIALS move towards the tunnel entrance. they march we see that they surround GENERAL WEST, 50's. The group disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawalsky leads Daniel, who carries a stack of papers, dow the hall. Kawalsky stops, opens a door marked BRIEFING RO Daniel enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Briefing room is packed; O'Neil, Catherine, Meyers, S and all the OFFICIALS we saw entering the compound. At th center of the conversation is General West. Daniel clearly wasn't expecting such an audience.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Daniel, I'd like you to meet General West.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: I've come a long way to hear this. Let's see what you've got. Daniel turns to Catherine who nods for Daniel to go ahead Daniel unfurls O'Neil's star map. Daniel circles one of t constellations.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: This is a star constellation. Orion. Identical to a symbol on the Tablets. The scientists exchange interested looks.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The symbols on the Tablets were not words. They were constellations. Put together in a meticulous and unique order, forming an address.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: An "address"? You mean coordinates?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Exactly. The centerpiece of the tablets holds the key. 56 57 58 59  24. Daniel draws the cartouche. Shore, Meyers and Catherine exchange a look. Even O'Neil leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This cartouche is a map. What we have here are the seven points to outline a course to a destination.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: Seven? Daniel draws a diagram indicating the six points needed t determine a destination (SEE DIAGRAM).

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: In order to find a destination in any three dimensional space we need to find two points to determine exact height, two points for width, and two points for depth. Those points are indicated here... (re: cartouche) ...with star constellations.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: You said you needed seven points?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Yes. While these symbols give us our destination, in order to chart our course we must have a point of origin.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: But there are only six symbols on the cartouche.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: That's because the point of origin is not inside the cartouche but below it, here. Daniel circles a small symbol at the base of the cartouch

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This here. This is the sign for Earth. The point of origin. The seventh symbol. There is a long silence. Daniel waits for a response. It is long in coming.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: (sly smile) He did it.  60 61 25.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Did what?

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: There is no symbol like that on the device.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: Perhaps some other kind of representation?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What device? Catherine turns to O'Neil and General.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: You'll have to show him. He's the only one who can identify it.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Would someone please tell me what's going on? The General thinks a moment, turns to O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Show him. O'Neil walks over to the back wall. He pushes a large BUT Suddenly the whole WALL SLIDES AWAY revealing a huge bay window looking out at a much larger room below. Surprised, Daniel turns. As Daniel walks over to the wind we PUSH IN TO SEE...

dialogues.speaker: MISSILE SILO
dialogues.text: Through the window we can see the converted missile silo packed with high tech equipment. In the center of all thi technology sits...

dialogues.speaker: THE METALLIC RING 61
dialogues.text: This ring, the same one found in Egypt over sixty years a now seems to be part of one gigantic functioning machine.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Your "Star Gate."

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Take him downstairs. See if he can identify this "seventh symbol."  62 63 64 26. Catherine nods and leads Daniel and the others out of the room, down to the silo. O'Neil and the General stay behin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controlled chaos. This room looks much like "mission control." Catherine escorts Daniel into the control booth He stares at the ring in total awe.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: While we didn't realize the symbols were star constellations, it was obvious to us that they match symbols written on the star gate. Problem was, we never knew about the seventh symbol. Through the observation window above, O'Neil and General West watch as a video camera moves across a TRACK closing on the details of the Star Gate. General West turns to O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: Jack, it's good to have you back. (O'Neil nods) How's your wife?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Some days are alright, others aren't. The General nods, understands.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AND CATHERINE 63
dialogues.text: Catherine leads Daniel next to a MONITOR that shows a det of the symbols written on the rim of the star gate. Danie stares at the screen, watching the symbols pass as the ri slowly rotates.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Hold it! Catherine turns, signals for the Star Gate to stop spinni Daniel walks closer to the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: Lifting a black marker to the screen, Daniel draws the sy he found below the cartouche OVER a symbol seen on the sc Clearly this symbol is the other representation of the sa sign.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: That's it. We must have been blind!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Let's try it.  65 27. Catherine picks up a phone. Above we SEE General West pic up a phone from behind the observation glass. He nods. Catherine hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (announcing) Let's run a test. Over a Mic, Shore gives instructions to two TECNICIANS wh program the ring to TURN, front part and back in differen directions, aligning the sides. Each section stopping at particular sign, matching the cartouche. Several ARMED GUARDS suddenly surround the star gate, protecting it, from what, we don't know. A Technician ope the top of the probe and places a caged RAT inside. As each symbol aligns on the StarGate, a LASER ignites in the center of the ring. Each additional laser builds the intensity of the light. Daniel is amazed. He adjusts his glasses to get a better look when they suddenly CRACK.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should have warned you about that.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (taking off his glasses) Incredible. As the Seventh Symbol is matched up, there is an audible HUM. The lasers BRIGHTEN and a strange light TUNNEL begin to form at the center of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: It's guiding itself. Can you believe this?! Suddenly every computer in the room begins to activate. Lights FLASH, data PRINTS out, technicians rush to deal w all the input. Shore turns around to SEE...

dialogues.speaker: MAP ON THE BACK WALL OF THE CONTROL ROOM 65
dialogues.text: A detailed schematic of the Universe. A small red laser CROSS HAIR begins to trek across the map, leaving Earth a traveling across the galaxy, stopping at the far end of t screen.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God, the beam has locked onto a point on the other side of our Galaxy!

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: It has mass. Could be a moon or large asteroid.  28.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Where are we on that map?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Blue dot. The flashing BLUE DOT is all the way on the OTHER SIDE of the screen, lower right corner.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right, Daniel. The other side of the known Universe. A PROBE is brought over to a ramp that leads into the cen of the RING.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: (filtered through microphone) Release the Probe. The crew finishes their last preparations and rushes away leaving the PROBE sitting on the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: Initiate count down. A COMPUTER COUNTDOWN begins. The technicians put on large DARK SECURITY GLASSES. Catherine hands a pair to Daniel w reluctantly puts them on. Suddenly the PROBE STARTS TO MOVE. The PROBE moves tank- like across the ramp heading directly into the center of RING. As the countdown reaches the end, the PROBE moves INTO THE RING. Suddenly there is an audible POWER SURGE. BLINDING WHITE LIGHT flashes from the RING. Even with the glasses, Daniel and the others cover their eyes. Suddenly the PROBE VANISHES! Shocked, Daniel looks to Catherine for an explanation. Sh gives none. A SECOND count down begins, counting down from 60... 59.. 58... 57... With baited breath, the entire crew remains motionless, waiting for the end of the countdown.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (whispered to Catherine) What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: We're waiting for it to come back.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Come back?  29.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Never has before. 32... 31... 30...

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: How is this possible?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: It's made out of a quartz unlike any found on Earth. Some kind of natural molecular disrupter. The device is made out of it. It breaks down atoms and sends them through another dimension. 22... 21... 20...

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: How long have you guys been working on this?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: My father found it when I was a child. But the Egyptian government didn't release it until '71. Then we had to get it from the British. And from there it took another ten years to get financing.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: From the Pentagon. 8... 7... 6... The tension is thick. Everyone in the room is anxious, waiting nervously. 3... 2... 1... Through the ring, a vague SHADOW can be seen coming from other side. Slowly the shadow takes the form of THE PROBE moving slowly and steadily down the ramp. Within seconds the ring TURNS ON ITS OWN and SHUTS DOWN. The whole room explodes with CHEERS. The armed guards surround the probe as it comes off the ramp. Two guards immediately begin to examine it. One guard opens the top the probe, removing the caged RAT; still alive and well. The technicians and crew members hug each other, congratulating one another. Meyers rushes over to Daniel shaking his hand, enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: Congratulations. I mean it.  66 30. Unlike everyone else, Daniel remains incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: They're planning on going through, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: That's what this was all about. Suddenly the phone rings. Catherine picks it up and tries to listen through all the cheering going on around her.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling to room) Quiet! Everyone! The room settles down. As Catherine's expression darkens, everyone in the room turns and looks at her, concerned. Slowly we PAN UP to the observation window. Unheard by us O'Neil finishes his conversation with Catherine. Slowly t wall LIFTS back up, COVERING the window. Slowly Catherine hangs up the phone and turns back to her cohorts.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're done. They're sending us all home. He said they're taking over from here.

dialogues.speaker: SHORE
dialogues.text: What?! Through the glass window of the control room we SEE...

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIANS
dialogues.text: Two Technicians move close to the probe. Suddenly several of the armed guards block their path, rifles lifted. Behi them Kawalsky instructs a guard who removes several DISKS from the probe. Confused, the Technicians turn back to Catherine.

dialogues.speaker: MEYERS
dialogues.text: They can't do this!

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Yes they can. Sadly she turns away, trying to hide her disappointment. Everyone is shocked as the armed guards, led by Kawalsky take the probe out of the silo. Daniel can't believe it. He turns and looks at the crestfallen faces around him. With a strange resolve, Dan storms out.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open as Kawalsky and two of the armed gua march in carrying the recording disks from the probe. The pass O'Neil and General West.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: It's up to you now, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: I'll be ready. Oh-six hundred hours. O'Neil turns and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: INT HALLWAY OUTSIDE BRIEFING ROOM
dialogues.text: Barely three steps out of the room, O'Neil is interrupted Daniel who races up, walking behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Just what the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: We'll release all intelligence at the appropriate time.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: And who's going to make that decision? The Pentagon?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Military intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: That's a contradiction in terms. Ignoring Daniel, O'Neil walks on.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do you think you'll be able to keep this quiet! The public will want to know. O'Neil stops, faces Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Who's going to tell them? You?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: If I have to.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: (contemptuous) Go ahead. Who do you think is going to believe you? You're a joke. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have no credibility left out there. Face it, your only interest here is to try and repair your damaged reputation.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: You're damned right I do. I've spent the better part of my life studying exactly what this project is all about. I've dedicated myself to it. What have you dedicated your life to, Colonel? The Colonel stares at him hard. He'd like to answer but won't.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: (cold; lethal) Pack your bags and get off this base. O'Neil turns and walks away. Frustrated, Daniel yells aft him.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: You're going to need me!

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He may be right. O'Neil and Daniel spin to see General West standing behin them.

dialogues.speaker: A HAND 69
dialogues.text: Pushes one of the recording disks from the probe into som kind of laser disk-type player.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: The monitor lights up and through the static-filled video see the interior of some architectural STRUCTURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel stands in front of the large wall sized monitor at the edge of the room. Behind are the military officials, Kawalsky and O'Neil. The image slowly rotates, panning around the room stone w Soon we pass over another STAR GATE, fully powered.  33.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Freeze and enhance. The image FREEZES. Digitally the image is ENHANCED as we artificially ZOOM closer, detailing the ring of the Star Gate. Fascinated, Daniel moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: The markings... they're different.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: That's why I wanted you to see this.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: The readouts tell us it's an atmospheric match. Barometric pressure, temperature and most importantly oxygen. All compatible to Earth. As we expected. The General steps behind Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: But I won't send our boys over there if I'm not absolutely sure I can bring 'em back.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: We know the beam will only stay connected for a short amount of time. After the ring shuts itself down, we'll have to re-establish the beam from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: We could re-establish from here.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Once our team goes through, this place will be evacuated and sealed. We don't know what might come through from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: So you want me to go over with the team, re-align the Star Gate and bring everyone back home.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Question is, can you do it? Daniel takes a beat, turns to O'Neil and Kawalsky who sta near the back of the room.  72 73 74 34.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Yes... I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Positive. General West turns to his counterparts who all nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Fine. You're on the team. Dismissed, Kawalsky escorts Daniel out of the room. Once they're both gone, O'Neil turns back to General West.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: He's smart. He won't go along with us if he figures it out.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Then it's your job to make sure he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trunk is CLOSED, sealed. Boxes, equipment and personnel are being shipped out. Among the busy foot traffic we see Meyers and Shore sadly walking out carrying their suitcas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personnel busses are loaded, people stowing their belongi Trucks packed with boxes of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is buttoning the final button on his standard mili issue combat uniform.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't like to travel. Daniel turns to find Catherine standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I got over it.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: I wanted to give you something. Catherine walks over to Daniel, taking something out of h pocket.  75 76 77 35.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This was found the same day as the Star Gate. It always brought me luck. She opens her hand, exposing the SUN DISK necklace.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I couldn't... Lifting the necklace, Catherine puts it on a grateful Dan

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: Bring it back to me. Overcome with emotion, Catherine turns away and hurries o Daniel watches her leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the busy traffic of people making their way out w SEE the silhouetted figure of Catherine walking away from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Neil marches towards the anxious and concerned faces of our away squad; Kawalsky, five SOLDIERS (We recognize the soldiers from Daniel's arrival) and Daniel. There's a long tense pause. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Does anyone want to say anything before we go? O'Neil walks past each member of the squad who look up at him and say nothing. SNEEZE. Everyone turns down the line looking at Daniel who wipes his nose with a Kleenex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abuzz with activity.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Initiate commencement sequence. Technicians making final adjustments to the computers. We MOVE up from the computer console to a MONITOR where we s a detail of the RING as it begins to TURN. As it turns we RACK FOCUS through the glass to the Star G In front of it we SEE a WHEELED VEHICLE getting packed wi equipment.  78 79 80 81 82 83 84 36.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (filtered through speaker) Cameras on. VIDEO CAMERAS spin from every angle of the silo, focusing the Star Gate. As we PAN UP from the multitude of cameras we stop at...

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION WINDOW
dialogues.text: Watching the activity below, the General sees the away sq led by O'Neil as they march into the silo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad walks over to the ramp. Four SOLDIERS move over to the wheeled vehicle, escorting it on either side as it slowly moves up the ramp. With three of the symbols already LOCKED IN, the Star Gat continues to ROTATE. The squad follows the vehicle up the ramp. Daniel looks u at the spinning Star Gate and swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Last sequence initiated.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEVENTH SYMBOL. 80
dialogues.text: Begins its turn. We FOLLOW IT as it slowly moves into pla

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST'S P.0O.V.
dialogues.text: The team stands below in the now empty silo, preparing to enter the ring. General West picks up the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL WEST
dialogues.text: Begin final evacuation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last of the technicians leave, the ENTRANCE DOORS the Star Gate room and control booth slowly SHUT and LOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General West presses a button and the wall covering SEALS over the window. The General turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEVENTH SIGN 84
dialogues.text: locks into place. The Star Gate STOPS ROTATING. The seven lasers IGNITE, forming the beginnings of the TUNNEL.  85 86 87 88 89 90 91 92 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General West, joined by his men, marches down through the elaborate hallways. Doors SHUTTING and SEALING behind the as they march.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vehicle hits the top of the ramp and enters INTO THE RING. Daniel stares in wonder at the sight. The entire vehicle and the men alongside EVAPORATE into the ring's center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last to leave, General West and his men exit the tunn entrance and two HUGE CONCRETE DOORS begin to MOVE, closi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoic, O'Neil is the first to march through after the veh He steps into the ring. Kawalsky turns back to the Soldier behind him. They excha apprehensive looks. Kawalsky turns back and walks in. The Soldier crosses himself and steps inside, revealing..

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: His heart in his throat, Daniel stares at the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the closing doors we SEE General West looking bac just as the two gigantic doors SEAL CLOSED, blackout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel shuts his eyes and steps into the beam.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Before our eyes we SEE Daniel broken down to the molecula level... ...he enters another dimension. A fourth dimension... ...traveling over millions of light years ou of our own time continuum... ...we then enter a gigantic black space, floating... unti sun-like light RUSHES towards us, engulfing us... ...the screen BURNS to COMPLETE AND TOTAL WHITE... Slowly out of the bright white light, a face forms. Molecules rush together. It's Daniel, covered with frost, dropping down his knees, clutching himself in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a pool of light beneath the Star Gate on the other sid (exactly like the one on Earth), Daniel is curled up, fre cold. Hands reach out for him. Panicked, Daniel knocks them away.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Jackson, you alright?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Calm down, Jackson, it's over. Squinting through the bright light, Daniel can just make the shapes of the other members of the squad, scattered a the room in various states of recovery. Coughing, squinting and shaking off the cold, the team co together. Suddenly the Star Gate begins to TURN on its own. As it STOPS the light at the ring's center SHUTS OFF. TOTAL BLACKNESS. A FLARE ignites. Adjusting to the new light we SEE O'Neil holding the flare, checking his men.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everyone alright? Slowly the squad nods. One soldier, LT. FERETTI, shakes i off.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FERETTI
dialogues.text: Tell me we don't have to go through that thing again. Daniel, slowly recovering, lifts himself up, dazed. A sec flare is LIT. Using the light, Daniel scans the room, spotting the Star Gate. He's amazed. As he looks around we SEE that we are in a massive stone surrounding, not nearly as big as the silo, yet still impressive. Behind Daniel the squad gathers equipment, readies to move out. One soldier, FREEMAN, attaches a light to a harness mount VIDEO CAMERA, while BROWN slips on a back pack connected a receiving DISH for collecting technical data. Brown che a readout monitor attached to the back of his arm. O'Neil moves over to a doorway leading to a short hallway He looks down the hallway and turns back to the squad.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Feretti, take point. First team.  94 95 96 97 98 39. Feretti lifts his rifle. He and another Soldier lead Brow through the doorway. Kawalsky and another Soldier move ac from O'Neil.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kawalsky, cover the rear. Kawalsky nods as O'Neil moves through followed by another soldier. Freeman adjusts his camera harness and follows. Kawalsky moves to follow, then turns back to Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: (whisper) Jackson! Daniel spins, nods and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly the squad makes its way through the dark hallway a across this small room. Brown checks his readout on the move. O'Neil and his team move quickly through, followed by Dan who stops, noticing something. He reaches forward and gra Freeman, turning his light down to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MEDALLION 95
dialogues.text: We see a large round MEDALLION on the floor. Tilting Freeman's light we look up to find a similar object on th ceiling above. Daniel doesn't know what to make of it. Annoyed, Freeman shakes himself loose from Daniel and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: Two small blue-ish flares ROLL towards us, landing to a b stop. Together they illuminate this GRAND GALLERY (a larg hallway leading upwards). Below us we see Feretti's face he peers upwards. He tosses another flare and enters with his team.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN 97
dialogues.text: Spinning and turning as he marches upwards into the Galle O'Neil and his team follow, guns ready, camera recording.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL 98
dialogues.text: at the rear, stares at the surroundings. Somehow it all seems familiar to him.  99 100 101 102 103 104 105 40.

dialogues.speaker: RAMPWAY TOP
dialogues.text: At the top of the rampway, the hall LEVELS off to a short hallway leading to another chamber. As the team arrives, they gather together awaiting instructions.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN HALLWAY 100
dialogues.text: Ahead of them, LIGHT can be SEEN in the next chamber, per leading outside. Brown, Feretti and another soldier move ahead of the rest, heading into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A much larger hallway filled with huge pillars. Feretti peels off to one side, the other soldier taking position across from him. Brown steps into the room, taking readin

dialogues.speaker: TEAM'S P.0.V.
dialogues.text: Silhouetted at the end of the hall, in the next room. Bro turns his back to us.

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: (off his readout) Conditions are similar to inside. Radiation, electromagnetic and other exposures, normal. The rest of the team moves onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously the team makes its way through this huge room, rotating positions, moving pillar at a time. Again, Brown and Feretti are the first to reach the doorway leading outside. Checking his readings, Brown turns back and gives the oka sign. The team follow.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL 104
dialogues.text: Totally awestruck, Daniel cannot believe what he's seeing He's thrilled. Nearly in a daze, Daniel takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S P.0.V.
dialogues.text: Following closely behind O'Neil, Daniel slowly makes his through the doorway out into the bright sunlight. Daniel finds himself on a large platform surrounded by SAND DUNE Ahead of him he SEES the soldiers who've taken defensive positions across the platform and Brown and Freeman who a amazed as they record all they survey.  106 107 108 109 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the entire team positioned across this mammoth structure. O'Neil turns to Kawalsky and Feretti.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: I want to see where the hell I am. Kawalsky, Feretti, secure the base of this ramp. I'm going to take a look around.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I'll go with you. O'Neil ignores Daniel as he follows Kawalsky and Feretti down the long ramp into the sands.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE RAMP 107
dialogues.text: At the base of the ramp stand two LARGE OBELISKS. Kawalsk and Feretti take positions on either side of the OBELISKS O'Neil and Daniel follow down the ramp and into the sand. Behind them, Freeman marches down with his camera. As he nears the base of the ramp he LIFTS his camera to get a b look at the structure they've just left. Slowly he moves away from his eyepiece.

dialogues.speaker: FREEMAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AND O'NEIL 108
dialogues.text: climb the dune across from the obelisks. Winded, Daniel reaches the top long after O'Neil. As Daniel catches his breath he turns to see what O'Neil looking at. Daniel is stunned, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S P.0O.V.
dialogues.text: Just like the great one of Egypt, only BIGGER and without any decay. Glorious and breathtaking. Looming just beyond the pyramid we see THREE SUNS in the bearing down on us. Thrilled, exhilarated and frightened, O'Neil and Daniel stand there in total awe. Too overwhelm to speak. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (thrilled) I knew it! O'Neil shoots him a look and heads back down the dune. Overjoyed, Daniel just stares at the horizon, filled with wonder. Halfway down, O'Neil turns back to him.  110 42.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Jackson, what are you waiting for? Daniel turns and follows.

dialogues.speaker: OBELISKS 110
dialogues.text: Kawalsky and Feretti move over to meet O'Neil as he walks over from the dune. Freeman continues to video everything

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: I want two men securing the hallways leading to the star gate, two men guarding the entrance of the structure. Freeman, you and Brown sweep the exterior surroundings...

dialogues.speaker: FREEMAN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Daniel rushes up from behind.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: ...and you, get to work. I want us re-establishing contact within the hour.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I need more time. There's bound to be more structures here, traces of Civilization...

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: What are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Look at it! It's an exact replica of the great pyramid of Giza. We're not going to find any hieroglyphic or pictorial displays. We've got to expand our search... Kawalsky and Feretti exchange a glance. O'Neil steps close to Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Your job is to re-align the star gate and get us back home. Can you do it or not? There's a long pause as Daniel decides to answer.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Can't or won't?  43. Feretti leans close to Kawalsky who stares at Daniel, pis

dialogues.speaker: FERETTI
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: If they marked the co-ordinates on tablets back on Earth, there must be something like that here. I just have to find it.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Find it!? That wasn't the deal!

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: FERETTI
dialogues.text: So we're stuck here. Great.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: You lying son of a bitch. Kawalsky SHOVES Daniel, hard.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Lieutenant! Kawalsky freezes. There is a long tense moment as Kawalsk finally eases off.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll set up base camp down here. Organize our supplies.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: But Colonel...

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: You have your orders. Reluctantly Kawalsky turns and leaves, Feretti in tow. Da stands up behind O'Neil who turns back to him. O'Neil tur and looks at Daniel, cold. After a pregnant beat, O'Neil turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: A HAMMER 111
dialogues.text: Slams down against a large tent SPIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shirtless Feretti ties down the cover tent; a larger te shading several smaller tents beneath. Sweating under the intense heat, Brown and Freeman unpack some equipment.  113 114 44.

dialogues.speaker: FREEMAN
dialogues.text: If we don't return soon, they'll just turn it back on from the other side, won't they?

dialogues.speaker: BROWN
dialogues.text: Who will? They sealed the silo! Don't you get it? There's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: FERETTI
dialogues.text: I'm telling you guys, we're stuck here! Pissed, Feretti takes out his frustration on another tent post, SLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the base of the ramp, Daniel struggles carrying a heav box. Another Soldier BUMPS into him as he passes, easily carrying his own load.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: No problem, I got it. Contemptuous, the other soldier doesn't even look back. Daniel begins the long climb up the dune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawalsky walks over to the wheeled vehicle to pick up the last two crates from its cargo area.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Base camp is set up, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: I've got that one. Kawalsky nods. He puts back down one of the crates and le with the other. Once gone, O'Neil moves over to the wheel vehicle, lifting off the last crate. He reaches into his pocket and produces a strange looking TOOL.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sir, permission to speak? O'Neil coolly palms the tool, hiding it and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Granted.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: I just wanted to apologize for losing my cool. It's just... this is all so... overwhelming.  115 45.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Don't let it happen again. O'Neil turns away. Hurt, Kawalsky would like to say more, doesn't. He leaves. O'Neil takes the tool, placing it int the floor boards of the vehicle. As he maneuvers the tool, a section of the floor COMES OF revealing a hidden compartment below. O'Neil reaches in a removes two heavy, SOPHISTICATED LOOKING DEVICES. Placing the Devices on the floor, he adjusts something on them, connecting the two pieces together. Joined, he open a common LID, exposing a small button. As he presses it, a square electrical "KEY" POPS UP. O'Neil pockets the "KEY" and shuts the lid, locking it.

dialogues.speaker: BASE CAMP 115
dialogues.text: Daniel struggles up the last few steps of the hill. He DR his cargo down, with a THUD. Exhausted, he sits.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Anyone have some sun block... say
The others turn away, ignoring his joke.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's in all these boxes, anyway? Daniel opens the box he carried, revealing DOZENS OF GUNS

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Jesus. You guys plan on fighting a war here? Feretti shoots him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: FERETTI
dialogues.text: Don't you have something you should be doing? Feretti lifts a large duffel and HEAVES it at Daniel, kno him over. The duffel rolls from his hands and all his BOO go TUMBLING DOWN the other side of the dune. Feretti smiles to Brown as Daniel reluctantly gets up and climbs down the dune after his belongings.  116 117 118 119 120 1214 46.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER DUNE
dialogues.text: Daniel makes his way clumsily down the sand, his books ar scattered everywhere. As he reaches over to pick up the empty duffel, he SEES...

dialogues.speaker: HOOF PRINTS
dialogues.text: in the sand. Deep set prints, walking around the next dun Daniel can't believe it. For a moment he considers going back and telling the others, thinks better of it and foll the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT DUNE 117
dialogues.text: As Daniel climbs to the top of the next dune he SEES the tracks continuing over the next sand dune. Daniel follows

dialogues.speaker: BASE CAMP
dialogues.text: O'Neil arrives carrying the last crate. He looks around, turns to Feretti.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Where's Jackson? The Soldiers exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: FERETTI
dialogues.text: He dropped his stuff. I think he went to pick it up. Feretti points in the direction Daniel went. O'Neil signa Brown and Kawalsky to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER DUNE
dialogues.text: O'Neil finds the books and bag scattered down the sand. Across from it several tracks, the beasts' and Daniel's. O'Neil shoots a look over to his men.

dialogues.speaker: SAND DUNES
dialogues.text: As Daniel reaches the top of the next dune he sees someth He crouches low, not to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S P.0O.V.
dialogues.text: Climbing beyond the next dune we SEE a large hairy BEAST. strange cross between a Mammoth and a Buffalo, (called a MASTADGE). Daniel is awestruck. Slowly and cautiously, Daniel starts to make his way towa it. Halfway down, however, the Mastadge TURNS, spotting Danie Daniel FREEZES in his tracks. So does the Mastadge.  122 47. After a long beat where no one moves, Daniel takes a step forward. The Mastadge takes a step back. Daniel freezes. The Mastadge takes a step forward but this time a nervous Daniel takes a step back. Both freeze. Daniel notices something on the head and neck of the Mast A HARNESS. He reaches into his picket and pulls out a SNICKERS BAR. He peels it and shows it to the Mastadge.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Hungry? With its great nostrils, the Mastadge SNIFFS the air. Dan inches closer as the Mastadge lowers its head. Slowly the Mastadge moves closer to Daniel, cautious. Carefully, Dan lifts the bar, closer to the animal's mouth. We RACK FOCU

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, BROWN AND KAWALSKY 122
dialogues.text: As they come over the top of the next dune, spotting Dani Kawalsky and Brown lift their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Don't feed it! Daniel turns, sees O'Neil, but ignores him. The Mastadge sticks out its MASSIVE TONGUE and LICKS the Snickers Bar. Daniel, nervous, drops the bar. The Mastadge leans down a picks it up with its teeth. Daniel smiles and moves closer to it. He reaches out and PETS the Mastadge. It makes a kind of PURRING SOUND as it eats. It's cute as hell. It nuzzles Daniel. Daniel turns to O'Neil, yells over to him.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Look, it's got a harness. It's domesticated. See? Daniel lifts one of the reins attached to the harness and shows it to O'Neil. O'Neil nods apprehensively, signals h men to lower their rifles.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a good old boy, aren't you. The beast seems to respond. Daniel smiles as he runs his hand over the Mastadge's head. But when Daniel's hand tou the beasts EARS, it REARS UP, ROARING. The Mastadge JUMPS UP onto its back legs. His reins get caught around Daniel's leg. Screaming the Mastadge KICKS and TAKES OFF RUNNING! Daniel gets DRAGGED OFF along with the beast.  123 124 125 126 127 128 48. O'Neil and the Lieutenants lift their weapons but the ani is too FAST. They watch as Daniel gets DRAGGED up and ove the next sand dune DISAPPEARING from sight.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: (yelling after Daniel) Let go of it! Frustrated, they lower their guns and take off after them

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AND MASTADGE
dialogues.text: Daniel is DRAGGED, screaming as he's pulled. Twisting and bumping. His mouth filling with sand. ANGLE - O'NEIL, KAWALSKY, AND BROWN. Huffing and puffing as they climb the top of the next dun Getting Daniel back in sight, they SEE how fast the Masta is.

dialogues.speaker: DESERT
dialogues.text: Daniel is PULLED AWAY farther and farther from O'Neil who chases from behind. No match for the speeding beast, the distance between them grows.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AND MASTADGE
dialogues.text: Off into the distance, Daniel gets dragged over a sand du out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, BROWN AND KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: Come running over a dune, guns raised. Suddenly they slow down as they SEE Daniel, laying in a heap, the Mastadge standing over him. The team keep their weapons trained on the beast as they approach from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AND MASTADGE
dialogues.text: Daniel spits out a mouthful of sand as the Mastadge leans over and begins to LICK HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Argh! Get your stinking breath away from me! (yelling back to O'Neil) Somebody help me! Finally O'Neil and his men arrive, but to Daniel's surpri they PASS right by him, lowering their guns.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Holy Jesus. 123 124 125 126 127 128  129 130

dialogues.speaker: 130A
dialogues.text: 131 49. Daniel looks up, spits out the sand in his mouth. He stan up and joins the others at a nearby ledge. He finally sees what they see...

dialogues.speaker: TEN THOUSAND PEOPLE 129
dialogues.text: Thousands of dark skinned PEOPLE populating the dune vall below. Humans, like on Earth, seemingly out of place and time. At the base of the huge dunes we see gigantic MINING PITS dark cavities in the sand. Dozens of ladders protrude out of the dark pits up the sides of the dunes. Covered with thick MUD, their faces barely recognizable a human, dozens of WORKERS climb the ladders carrying heavy loads on their backs. At the top of the sand craters we see women and younger workers, sifting through the piles of dirt carried out of the pit. Mastadges harnessed to huge carts, to carry the worker's cargo.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL AND THE OTHERS 130
dialogues.text: The brutal humanity of this work is a terrifying sight. Amazed, they can't believe what they're seeing. O'Neil li a pair of binoculars, scanning the area.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Spread across the sands, we SEE these people carrying out back breaking labor. Suddenly a worker in the foreground turns and looks DIRECTLY AT US. O'Neil lowers his glasses just as he SEES... The workers start LOOKING UP, spotting them. The news SPREADS and mor and more workers put down their tools and turn to the hillside. Several of the groups crowd closer, staring up the strange visitors. Reacting, Kawalsky slowly lifts his rifle. O'Neil reaches over, grabbing the barrel of the gun, stopping him. He signals for the others to follow him down the dune.

dialogues.speaker: GROUPS OF WORKERS 131
dialogues.text: Gathering together, moving closer. As they assemble they grow quiet, reverent. The team cautiously makes their way down the sloping hill in the tense silence. Wind whistling through the hollow pits. The Mastadge follows Daniel closely as they head do the hill.  132 50.

dialogues.speaker: THOUSANDS OF WORKERS 132
dialogues.text: All staring over at our crew as they arrive just a few ya in front of the assembled crowd. Nervously the crew smile out at the workers who stare at them with a mixture of aw and fear.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: (under his breath to Daniel) Okay, Daniel. It's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: Try and talk to them. Daniel has no idea what to do. Slowly he walks over, a fo smile for the crowd. He steps up close to a MUDDY WORKER.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL
dialogues.text: (petrified) Re... hello? The Worker looks at him with curiosity. Suddenly a FLASH reflected LIGHT shines off of the Golden Sun Disk around Daniel's neck. As the worker SEES this, his eyes widen. Suddenly he SCREAMS something out, frightening our crew. All at once, the entire assembly in a wave-like chain rea BOWS DOWN, FLAT ON THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: KAWALSKY
dialogues.text: (whispered) What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL
dialogues.text: I don't know. They take a few steps closer to Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: O'NEIL, (CONT'D)
